body: LGTM.
@junrao and @ijuma I addressed your comments. Please let me know if you have any more comments. Thanks!
@guozhangwang reverted previous and add thread name instead as suggested.
Left a few minor comments, looks good otherwise.
@kichristensen Thanks, I left a few minor comments, it looks good otherwise. Having said that, I am not very familiar with the streams code, so @guozhangwang please double-check.

In general LGTM.

Regarding examples:
- I would add a brief class jjavadoc to each example (such as `PageViewUnTypedJob`) to explain what each example does/what it demonstrates.  We might want to highlight typed vs. untyped differences, the need for Java 8 when using lambdas, etc.
- `PageViewUnTypedJob` should be renamed to `PageViewUntypedJob` (lower-case `t`)?
@hachikuji It seems that I do not have sufficient permissions to create the KIP wiki page. Here's an initial draft: https://gist.github.com/noslowerdna/577e25182d69306532d1

@tomdearman This maybe a transient error but I have not seen it before on Jenkins:

```
org.apache.kafka.connect.runtime.WorkerSourceTaskTest.testCommitFailure
```

I will re-run the unit tests on my local machine. Did it all pass on yours?
LGTM
@apovzner Thanks for the updates. LGTM
@miguno @ymatsuda Ready for review again.
@noslowerdna What's your apache id? I can ask someone to give you access.
@hachikuji Thanks, I'm "noslowerdna" there also.
LGTM.
@noslowerdna I asked @gwenshap to give you wiki permissions.

@jcustenborder Looks like there are a couple of test failures:

```
org.apache.kafka.connect.runtime.WorkerSourceTaskTest > testCommitFailure FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError:
      Expectation failure on verify:
        Listener.onStartup(job-0): expected: 1, actual: 1
        Listener.onShutdown(job-0): expected: 1, actual: 0
        at org.easymock.internal.MocksControl.verify(MocksControl.java:225)
        at org.powermock.api.easymock.internal.invocationcontrol.EasyMockMethodInvocationControl.verify(EasyMockMethodInvocationControl.java:132)

        at org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.verifyAll(PowerMock.java:1405)
        at org.apache.kafka.connect.runtime.WorkerSourceTaskTest.testCommitFailure(WorkerSourceTaskTest.java:259)
```

```
org.apache.kafka.connect.runtime.WorkerSourceTaskTest > testPollsInBackground FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError:
      Expectation failure on verify:
        Listener.onStartup(job-0): expected: 1, actual: 1
        Listener.onShutdown(job-0): expected: 1, actual: 0
        at org.easymock.internal.MocksControl.verify(MocksControl.java:225)
```

Looks like they could be due to fallout from merging w/ KAFKA-3093.
@tomdearman LGTM overall, could you address @ijuma 's comments before merging?
Unit test passed locally, filing a separate JIRA for the transient failure. LGTM and merged to trunk.

@guazhangwang, I haven't worked on this I think you intended it for someone
else.

On Fri, 26 Feb 2016, 22:55 Guozhang Wang notifications@github.com wrote:

> @tomdearman https://github.com/tomdearman LGTM overall, could you
> address @ijuma https://github.com/ijuma 's comments before merging?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/912#issuecomment-189516723.
My bad, I meant to @kichristensen
ping @ewencp
@gwenshap Do we want to kick off a system test job for this? I'm not super concerned since the timeout is generous, but might be nice to validate before committing.
@ijuma @guozhangwang I've addressed the comments. Please review again

Hi @tomjiang1987.
I think there is a case which needs to record stdout to any file in daemon mode.
Would you like to be able to specify the file which records it?
(If you don't need to record stdout, you can specify this file to /dev/null)
LGTM, perhaps @ewencp can have a final look?

LGTM. @ewencp do you mind taking a look? 

We are also using egrep in compatibility test. @apovzner is working on that. Maybe we can fix the compatibility test in that ticket as well.
@sasakitoa  I don't see any option to set the stdout file path when start broker,and the stdout content is same as server.log output.
Seams like a useful option. LGTM
@allenxwang, can you please fix the merge conflicts?
This looks good to me.
@hachikuji could you help merge this change, if you are ok with it?

@jhspaybar I'm running into this problem with my Integration tests, which randomly fail because of it.

Why was this PR closed?  Is there another PR that addresses this issue?  A spot check suggests that this problem still exists on trunk, 0.8.2 and 0.9 branches.  Is there a workaround?
@miguno Polished comments upon your comments.

I closed it because I no longer had the desire to follow up and try to get this merged. Feel free to pick it back up and/or reopen. It was listed as a newbie bug to fix, but adding tests to it seemed pretty intense so I left it.

LGTM. Jenkins failures are due to transient known errors.

Merged to trunk.
LGTM, merged to trunk.

@ijuma Done with resolving conflicts. Would appreciate if this can be reviewed and merged with a higher priority as it touches multiple areas and easy to get conflicts if sitting there for a bit longer.
@guozhangwang: LGTM :+1:
@allenxwang I was looking for the changes to TopicMetadataRequest, but didn't see them. Were you planning to do them here?

@hachikuji @allenxwang I need to make changes to TopicMetadata response too for KIP-4. We also need to migrate to the new TopicMetadata Request/Responses on the server side [KAFKA-2073](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-2073). We should probably migrate before making changes. Otherwise we need to make the changes in both the Java and Scala classes.
@granthenke Makes sense to me. I can pick up 2073 if you haven't already started.

@hachikuji Feel free to pick it up. I have some intermediate changes I can share with you later tonight. The hardest part about migrating was MetadataCache. You more or less need to re-implement it because its tied very heavily to the old requests/responses. After that I had some test failures that I haven't had a chance to dig into. I was thinking adding some additional tests may help flush out the issues more clearly too.

@hachikuji @granthenke I am not going to include changes to TopicMetadataRequest/Response in this PR which was indicated in the KIP discussion thread. You are free to do it in later on after this is merged.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
build failure is unrelated: kafka.network.SocketServerTest > tooBigRequestIsRejected FAILED
@allenxwang Have you opened another JIRA for the topic metadata changes? We should probably make sure we don't lose track of them.

@hachikuji @allenxwang I can include them in my changes to the response for KIP-4. I will open a jira to track that.  It would be nice to make all the changes at once anyway. I will ask for your feedback @allenxwang when posting to proposed changes.
Kicking tests. I tested locally without failure.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM. Could you rebase?
@hachikuji I have created [KAFKA-3306](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3306) to track updating the metadata response. I should have a preliminary patch this week.
Could you update the examples to use StreamsConfig.AUTO_OFFSET_RESET_CONFIG as well?
examples are updated.
cc @guozhangwang
LGTM. Merged to trunk.
Talked with @ijuma offline about the issues. LGTM. Merged to trunk.
@junrao I've merged the latest from master.

> I don't see any option to set the stdout file path when start broker

Sorry for confusing description.
I wanted to say I think it is good to code change to specify stdout file path.
@junrao I addressed your latest comments. Let me know if any more comments. Thanks!

Flaky test? Passed on my laptop and on Jenkins before the last commit.

Test Result (2 failures / +1)
kafka.api.SslConsumerTest.testAutoCommitOnRebalance
kafka.network.SocketServerTest.testSocketsCloseOnShutdown

@hachikuji 
Is there anything more I can do for this patch?
@gwenshap just a reminder on this.
@ijuma @ewencp Checking in for review.
@allenxwang Thanks for the work on this. I did a quick review. Will have to come back for a more in depth look.
@ijuma Thanks for the review. I updated the patch.
LGTM
@ewencp Mind taking a look?
KIP link: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-49+-+Fair+Partition+Assignment+Strategy
KIP link: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-49+-+Fair+Partition+Assignment+Strategy

cc @granthenke 

Lots of cleanup needed to make this possible, but hopefully not too controversial. I tried to decouple the Cluster object from the MetadataResponse so that it was more of a "pure" response object and not too tied to client-side logic. Other than that, the main work was in MetadataCache and KafkaApis as would be expected.

@hachikuji Overall I really like all the cleanup and decoupling. I just have a concern about compatibility. Its not likely to affect most users, but we may still want to be sure we maintain the old constructors, etc.
Would love to have this committed when someone has time :)
LGTM. Just a minor comment.

It seems there are now compilation errors?

/jenkins/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/core/src/main/scala/kafka/tools/ConsoleConsumer.scala:130: not enough arguments for constructor ConsumerRecord: (x$1: String, x$2: Int, x$3: Long, x$4: Long, x$5: org.apache.kafka.common.record.TimestampType, x$6: Long, x$7: Int, x$8: Int, x$9: K, x$10: V)org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord[K,V].
Unspecified value parameters x$8, x$9, x$10.
        formatter.writeTo(new ConsumerRecord(msg.topic, msg.partition, msg.offset, msg.timestamp, msg.timestampType,
                          ^
/jenkins/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/core/src/main/scala/kafka/tools/SimpleConsumerShell.scala:226: not enough arguments for constructor ConsumerRecord: (x$1: String, x$2: Int, x$3: Long, x$4: Long, x$5: org.apache.kafka.common.record.TimestampType, x$6: Long, x$7: Int, x$8: Int, x$9: K, x$10: V)org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord[K,V].
Unspecified value parameters x$8, x$9, x$10.
                formatter.writeTo(new ConsumerRecord(topic, partitionId, offset, message.timestamp,
The reason for the compiler errors is that the branch needs to be rebased after https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/695fdc69db6e080419bb05d624e91fa88d5c0a02 was merged.

Ping @ymatsuda for reviews:

1) For all internal source topics, pre-validate the topic with the number of partitions to:
    a. number of partitions to the co-partition topics if there is any.
    b. maximum number of partitions to the depending sub-topologies (i.e. whose sink nodes include this internal source topic).

2) After calling partition grouper, re-validate the changelog and internal source topics to the maximum number of tasks.partitionId + 1.

3) move the co-partition checking logic to StreamsPartitionAssignor.
This the pointed out by Avi Flax. Ping @ymatsuda for reviews.
LGTM
@ewencp @ijuma @gwenshap Pinging for review.
What happens if auto.create.topics.enable=false?
You mean this? https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_systest_branch_builder2/35/

streams-examples.jar was empty before.

@fpj @enothereska @ymatsuda Ping for reviews.
@gwenshap ping for review.
@gwenshap mind taking a look at this trivial patch.
Unit tests passed locally.
LGTM

@ewencp Thanks, will fix.
Thanks for the patch. Just had a minor comment. Otherwise, LGTM.
@ymatsuda addressed comments.
@ewencp Ping again.
LGTM
@ijuma @junrao Thanks, I rebased and fixed compilation errors.

Note: This doesn't exactly resolve KAFKA-2944 (i.e. we may still get into a bad state with commits we can't account for), but since it does change the error from NPE to "Received a commit message for connector " + connectorName + " but there is no matching configuration for tasks in this connector. This should never happen.", with less extreme results (i.e. the log reading thread should not blow up), I think this may allow up to close this specific JIRA and continue with a different one debugging a less severe condition.

Another note: This adds a debug log for every single config read and write. I'm assuming configs are usually not huge and we are not re-configuring that frequently. If the logs will become unreadable, we can revisit.

@gwenshap Left one comment and also think you may have missed logging something in `putConnectorConfig`. Otherwise LGTM and am happy to commit after answering these questions.

I suppose one last thing is if we want to file that follow-up JIRA, we could put the JIRA ID either into the code or the error message so they both get resolved together when we finally track down the issue.
